VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
period under review and the compliance with the CAP is as follows: The CAP was
for last year’s interim audit for employee records not having a performance
evaluation and references completed after employement. There were four special
investigations during the period under review with none of the investigations
requiring a CAP. CAP monitoring was conducted with the facility and the facility
has complied with the CAP.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on review of the facility's budget
and agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
There was a fire at one of the licensed houses on property where the youths in
that home moved to Hainley House. As a result, Hainley House changed their
program from short-term intensive stabilization to mental health/behavior
stabilization programing. This was not the direction Eagle Village saw for Hainley
House but due to circumstances things changed and they adjusted accordingly.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed stated feeling the house was in a "reset" mode after having youth
move from a different house on campus due to a fire at that house into the Hainley
House. Staff reported the youth are getting their needs met, Eagle Village goes
above and beyond for the youth and staff have been more consistent with firm
expectations. Staff did not identify any concerns.
Youth interviewed reported having many activities available to them on campus
and going on "adventures" off campus. Youth stated staff step in to stop youth
who bully or try to fight. Youth were able to name multiple staff who are their
favorites and did not express any concerns with how staff interact with them. The
youth interviewed did not express any concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walk through of the facility occurred on January 2 and
25, 2024. There were no issues or safety concerns.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
